releases.title: DIY installer creator packs disabled devices in installer

changes.title: DIY installer creator packs disabled devices in installer
Grating motor curve is recalculated even if it exists when modifying interaction
Additive calibration curves might cause false positive sanity check error ('Motor position is out of range')
Motor maximal and minimal velocities are checked to be lower than 4096
Neutral positions in optical calibration can use named motor positions
Support for motors with custom reset logic
Position of named motor position can be quickly changed to current motor position from main motor control, by right clicking on the button or combo-box entry
Default curve interpolation mode is linear (was spline)
Check DIY installer creator executable file size

releases.title: Show number of wavelength range gaps in calibration and where they are (except in User access level)

changes.title: Show number of wavelength range gaps in calibration and where they are (except in User access level)

On optical device import do not skip interactions that already exist (i.e. interactions with the same name)

Mixed motors hardware support

User can be prompted to accept EULA anytime ('Tools>Request accept user license agreement')

releases.title: Application Insights

changes.title: Application Insights
CMP-SIG template in Create interaction tab uses SIG as mapping wavelength mapping function
Saved motors positions list in single device tab does not show vertical scrollbar if there isn't enough space

releases.title: Add buttons 'delete current configuration' to optical and separation configurations

changes.title: Add buttons 'delete current configuration' to optical and separation configurations

Change calibration motor curve offset control to indicator, add two new buttons : 'Set offset' and 'Shift curve to make offset zero'. 'Add current offset' button renamed to 'Shift curve by current diff'.
Calibration motor curve points are always auto-ordered by wavelength, user can't reorder

releases.title: Add link to [Topas4 info page](https://domasm.github.io/Topas4Info/) in three different locations

changes.title: Add link to [Topas4 info page](https://domasm.github.io/Topas4Info/) in three different locations
Beautified local (per device) API help pages, add more info to some methods

releases.title: Decrease power on still does not work at all

changes.title: Decrease power on still does not work at all
Shutter is opened when it shouldn't be:
'Calibration>Optical' adds current motor position instead of target when modifying motor curve
'Tools>Create Installer with current configuration' fails with multiple self-hosted servers due too short timeout
Before starting server with configured TCP ports, server checks if they aren't used by other applications and informs user if so instead of crashing
When calculating motor positions for wavelength, neutral positions are used only from optical devices that are actually used to set requested wavelength
Device location might not work if PC isn't connected to LAN
When connecting to new device in client application, named motor positions and forbidden ranges might not be synced
Motor curves, if they have points with 'None' interpolation, are incorrectly converted  when using SIG<>IDL conversion with explicit IDL motor curves
'Calibration>Create interaction' informs user if end wavelength<=start wavelength

Import anything from zipped configuration. User can inform any part of optical configuration (whole optical configuration, optical device, interaction, motor curve), separation configuration (...), or motor property from zipped server configuration
Start a new self hosted server from zipped configuration (optionally as demo, i.e. without actual hardware)

Forbidden motor ranges: each motor has a list of forbidden positions ranges.  If shutter is open when motor is entering forbidden range it will be closed by server and reopened after motor leaves forbidden range. Shutter can't be opened while motor is in forbidden range.
On hardware failure, inform user to power-cycle device, reconnect USB and restart server application (pop-up in Client)
Hidden motors : if motor socket is installed in Topas3 board, but there is no motor connected, you can completely hide it from clients
'Update is available' message in title bar
Rectangle around motor control
All self-hosted servers in \Resources\SelfHostedServer are launched on start. Prepend '_' to folder name to ignore server (P17189 >> _P17189).
Motor controls can be used with mouse in interactive mode ('Calibration>Optical')
Calibration and Motors tabs are not visible in User Access Level

Shutter has three states: open, closed and temporarily closed. Shutter in temporarily closed state can't be opened by user, but will be opened by server after reason why it was closed is no longer valid: e.g. motor leaves forbidden range, wavelength setting is finished
Order of named motor positions is kept unchanged after modifying position/name/short name
To close device tab, Shift key has to be held while clicking x button
Can't open shutter during motor reset
Bigger Interactions and Messages buttons
